section.p: In , all entry fields are automatically assigned a name. You can change the field name to any other name. The changed names are used in all windows where dictionary entry data is displayed. For example, you may want to change Headword to Term, or Part of speech to Category. You can also change the field names to another language of your preference.
You can change the entry field names of an existing dictionary when you create a new dictionary.

section.title: Prerequisites
section.p: Decide which dictionary entry field names you want to use in your dictionary.

section.title: Calling sequence
section.p:
When creating a new dictionary, select:
The Dictionary List window.
New… from the File menu. The New Dictionary window is displayed.
Yes… next to the Change entry fields option.
The entry field you want to rename in the Change Entry Fields window.
Change name…

When changing the properties of an existing dictionary, select:
The Dictionary List window
The dictionary to which you want to make changes
Properties… from the File menu
The entry field you want to rename in the Dictionary Properties window
Change name…
The Change Entry Field Name window is displayed.

section.title: Options and parameters
section.p: Type the new field name in the Displayed as field. Click Change to rename the selected field.

section.title: Results
section.p: The selected dictionary entry field is renamed.
You are returned to the Change Entry Fields window when you create a new dictionary or to the Dictionary Properties window when you change the properties of an existing dictionary.
